Article.ArticleTitle: Magnetic and Electrical Performance of Atomic Layer Deposited Iron Erbium Oxide Thin Films.

AbstractText: Mixed films of a high-permittivity oxide, Er<sub>2</sub>O<sub>3</sub>, and a magnetic material, Fe<sub>2</sub>O<sub>3</sub>, were grown by atomic layer deposition on silicon and titanium nitride at 375 °C using erbium diketonate, ferrocene, and ozone as precursors. Crystalline phases of erbium and iron oxides were formed. Growth into three-dimensional trenched structures was demonstrated. A structure deposited using tens to hundreds subsequent cycles for both constituent metal oxide layers promoted both charge polarization and saturative magnetization compared to those in the more homogeneously mixed films.
